data.title: Cannot set breakpoints in skew source
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.2

I'm trying to step debug through skew language files in VSCode using the chrome-debugger extension. These have the .sk extension.   I can't set any breakpoints on these files, but I can step through/break into the source with source maps enabled.   VSCode debugger occasionally jumps back to compiled.js file and then I can set breakpoints in the js code.  I could turn off sourceMaps, but I want to work with the original source.

remote-debugging chrome launch at 9222
webRoot www
url           http://localHost:8000/...../www/index.html

on my drive
www
source <- renamed from src due to other VSCode bug
www/source  <- symbolic link up from webRoot, only way sourceMaps are matched up

I tried setting the webroot one level up, but then even though diagnostics reports the correct sourceMap full path, break/step only occurs in the compiled.js.  This is the only method I've found to step through the .sk files.

Why can't I even set breakpoints in source files?  They're not gray, they're not red, I just cannot set them in the source.  That's with debugging enabled/disabled.

data.title: The “left” “right” “center” label in Open Editors take too much space

If you split your editor (which is common when using a wide screen), two rows are used.
Maybe you can replace text labels with a horizontal line.

data.title: Updated to latest, installed extensions are gone and cannot reinstall
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:50:12.291Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.2.0-41-generic

Steps to Reproduce:
Using under Ubuntu Linux 15.10, 
1. Quit Visual Studio Code 1.2  
2. run .deb file to update from 1.2 to 1.3 
3. Click More -> Show Installed Extensions , no extensions show up
4. Hit ctl-P, type 'ext install python' (for example)
5. Python shows up in Extensions sidebar.  Click on Install.
6.  Nothing happens, nothing is installed.

data.title: Too long path of an extension side effects in Windows flipping to TEMP user profile
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.\* and 1.3
- OS Version: Win7
- User: User with a roaming profile

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Have an Windows user with a roaming profile
1. Install VS Code
2. Make sure that your .vscode got created within profile
3. Install extension with a bit too long path, i.e. lukehoban.Go-0.6.39 will do
4. From now on 
- in your profile might be already corrupted (logout might take longer or on login you will get TEMP profile)
- upon login, in Event Viewer, you should see something along the lines of
  Windows cannot copy file \?\UNC\SOMESERVER$\profile$\SOMEPROFILE.vscode\extensions\lukehoban.Go-0.6.39\node_modules\console-stamp\node_modules\dateformat\node_modules\meow\node_modules\normalize-package-data\node_modules\validate-npm-package-license\node_modules\spdx-expression-parse\node_modules\spdx-license-ids to location \?\C:\Users\SOMEPROFILE.vscode\extensions\lukehoban.Go-0.6.39\node_modules\console-stamp\node_modules\dateformat\node_modules\meow\node_modules\normalize-package-data\node_modules\validate-npm-package-license\node_modules\spdx-expression-parse\node_modules\spdx-license-ids. This error may be caused by network problems or insufficient security rights. 
  
  DETAIL - The filename or extension is too long.

I suppose it's related to #3884 as having extensions outside profile or even in AppData wouldn't cause such issue?

data.title: Cannot debug node v6.3.0 when files resides on a subst drive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.4.0-insider (4b84f6d791203e71fee10537f27fc8add9357160, 2016-07-08T07:45:28.445Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14383

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a new folder (e.g. `C:\test`)
2. run `subst X: C:\test`
3. open the root of drive `X:` in VSCode
4. create a new javascript file with some code (a simple `console.log(__dirname)` will do)
5. configure VSCode to start the file you just created
6. set a breakpoint in the file
7. start debugging
8. PROBLEM: the breakpoint is never hit.

This is related to nodejs issue [#7294](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/7294)

data.title: Debugger unable to attach to process
jQuery not supported in new version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.0 (e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703, 2016-07-07T16:56:12.476Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. This is an Angular2 application built with the CLI
2. I am loading jQuery in the index.html
3. I am using typings 1.3.0
4. I have jquery.d.ts installed in the typings directory and referenced in index.d.ts
5. The old version recognized jQuery. The new one does not.

I am trying to release production code and really need jQuery in my typescript.

data.title: Images are not showing on markdown preview on v1.3.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

```
Version 1.3.0
Commit e724f269ded347b49fcf1657fc576399354e6703
Date 2016-07-07T16:50:12.291Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
```
- OS Version:

```
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS
Release:    14.04
Codename:   trusty
```

Steps to Reproduce:
1. put an image under your project directory (e.g. `.docs/media/Screenshot from 2016-03-04 15:47:50.png`)
2. create a makrdown file, reference the image inside it:

```
![](.docs/media/Screenshot from 2016-03-04 15:47:50.png)
```
1. hit `CTRL+SHIFT+V` and you will see that image is not being rendered.

data.title: Make Quick Open use the new Preview editor to display results (like sublime's find anything)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 64bit & Mac OS X 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the Quick Open box
2. Type a file name that returns several results
3. A new Preview editor pops up and receives focus with the first result loaded into it
4. Scroll through the results in the Quick Open box and the Preview editor changes to the file that's highlighted
5. Selecting a result will fully open the file. Canceling can close the Preview editor or leave it open. I'd prefer if it closed the preview.

data.title: Show close (all) tab keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a couple of tabs
2. Hover over the close button of the tab until a popup appears `Close`

I think it would be nice of the keybinding (default <kbd>Cmd</kbd>+<kbd>w</kbd>) was shown in the hover popup label. Same goes for the `Close all` action when pressing the 3 dots on the side of the panel.

If I find some time I will do a PR for this if you guys agree on it.

// @bpasero

data.title: Search in folder (absolute include path search) should override excluded search settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set "search.exclude" to:

``` js
"search.exclude": {
  "**/node_modules": true,
  "**/bower_components": true
},
```
1. Right-click on a `bower_components` folder and choose "Find in Folder"

Since the folder is excluded through settings, no results will show in your searches. 

What I would expect is that if an absolute path "files to include" (not glob) would be completely excluded by the exclude settings, it would prefer the includes. I don't want to right-click on my "public" folder and get "bower_components" results, but if I search specifically on the "bower_components" folder I would want to see the results.
